intro: Orthaea weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's orthaea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a distinctive veining pattern. Orthaea weberbaueri is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
